conversation_summary: The rust-eaten roller-coaster car hangs at the cloud-veined summit; its loose harness swings like a snapped spine. Father’s surgical steel glints between his knuckles, his blank-smile face inching the needle toward the dreamer’s temple while carnival lights below stitch frantic red circuits across the dark. Every mouth in the tilted world opens in the same silent syllable: “Stop.” Then gravity forgets its name and the track ahead dissolves into spinning black.
